title: Voyageurs National Park: Birds
body: Birds         A Hairy Woodpecker forging for insects.   The large lakes and vast forests of Voyageurs create diverse habitats for over 100 species of birds. Loons and cormorants are often seen in deeper areas of the lakes diving for a meal of fish. Grebes, ducks, and mergansers can be found floating around in quiet shallow bays. The mixture of boreal and deciduous tree species provides excellent breeding and foraging grounds for song birds, including 24 species of warblers. For more bird exploration  Bald Eagle Common Loon Double-crested Cormorant
